column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////The staff was friendly and the ambiance was homey. The food was heinous. The cheese tastes like rubber. I got the gluten free option
column2: it tasted like alcohol from the yeast and was doughy
column3: undercooked. The sauce was flavorful and the only redeeming part of the pizza. The cannoli dip was bland and inauthentic
column4: tasted like whip cream. The tortillas tasted burnt and were bland as well. Never coming back. Not worth the money.
